title: "The Importance of Retiring on Time and Finding Purpose"
first_phrase: In this text, the author emphasizes the importance of retiring at the right time to achieve true freedom. He mentions Schopenhauer's viewpoint that someone who is no longer obligated to work and has control over their time and resources has a different substance than those who are bound by the need to earn a living. However, even those who choose to retire must have the energy and desire to enjoy their freedom; otherwise, they risk being consumed by boredom. The author then emphasizes the importance of striving to earn as much money as possible while working as little as possible, while also being clear about what one wants to achieve. This is achievable by identifying and eliminating unnecessary actions, thoughts, and words while organizing activities towards achieving one's ultimate goal.
content: La cosa è possibilissima, purché ci si decida a prendere responsabilità di sé stessi e si parta da un punto di vista realista e basato sul presente e sulla disponibilità ad andare al di là delle nostre “fissità” emozionali e di pensiero che sono il più grosso ostacolo al nostro avanzamento. Ciò significa in pratica: 1) Eliminare tutte le scorie, le azioni, i pensieri, le parole inutili, considerando inutili anche e sopratutto le ripetizioni non necessarie. 2) Organizzare l'attività, anziché lasciarla al caprìccio dell'automatismo psicologico, in modo tale che il fine supremo da noi propostoci si avvìi ad ogni minuto verso la sua realizzazione o ogni nostro pensiero, ogni nostra parola, ogni nostro atto, ci avvicinino o almeno non ci allontanino da tale scopo.
last_phrase: In conclusion, achieving our goals and realizing our potential is possible if we take responsibility for ourselves, adopt a realistic perspective, and overcome emotional and mental barriers. This involves eliminating unnecessary actions and thoughts, organizing our activities towards our desired outcome, and adapting to different situations while staying true to ourselves. By breaking free from our ego, we can access our true potential and experience a sense of liberation and fulfillment in our lives.
